poem:
**Signal to Noise**

In the vast Australian outback,  
an array reaches for distant whispers,  
but closer in, human voices  
tangle in the static of accusation.  
A whistleblower steps away,  
leaving behind echoes  
of questions unanswered,  
while the stars above  
remain indifferent,  
steadfast in their shimmering silence.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Whistleblower resigns in protest after inquiry finds ‘no credible evidence’ of wrongdoing at SKA Observatory The organisation behind the Square Kilometre Array Observatory in outback Western Australia says an independent investigation into claims of financial mismanagement has found “no credible evidence” of any wrongdoing. In August, Guardian Australia reported on whistleblower complaints regarding the global radio astronomy project, including claims that funds had been lost through external trading accounts and concerns around procurement. On Monday,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
